/ [`String`](std::string::String)s).  The following example shows how to use

defs.name: DesktopEnv
defs.value:
pub enum DesktopEnv {
    Gnome,
    Windows,
    Lxde,
    Openbox,
    Mate,
    Xfce,
    Kde,
    Cinnamon,
    I3,
    Aqua,
    Ios,
    Android,
    WebBrowser,
    Console,
    Ubuntu,
    Ermine,
    Orbital,
    Unknown(String),
}

defs.name: Platform
defs.value:
pub enum Platform {
    Linux,
    Bsd,
    Windows,
    MacOS,
    Ios,
    Android,
    Nintendo,
    Xbox,
    PlayStation,
    Fuchsia,
    Redox,
    Unknown(String),
}

defs.name: devicename
defs.docs:
Get the device name (also known as "Pretty Name"), used to identify device
 for bluetooth pairing.

defs.name: distro_os
defs.docs: Get the name of the operating system distribution and (possibly) version.

attributes.value: / Get the name of the operating system distribution and (possibly) version.
/ Returned as iterator of two letter language codes (lowercase), optionally
/ followed by a dash (-) and a two letter region code (uppercase).  The most
/ preferred language is returned first, followed by next preferred, and so on.
